Compliance Check Name: 5.1 Ensure no Network ACLs allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to remote server administration ports
Policy Name: Network ACL should restrict access over remote administration ports
Remediation:
Perform the following commands to delete or modify an inbound NACL rule to restrict remote administration ports access to specific entities via AWS CLI:   
**1.** To view the current NACL configuration:   
```  
aws ec2 describe-network-acls --network-acl-ids {{naclId}}  
```  
**2.** To modify an inbound rule, use the rule number from the previous output in the following command, and insert the wanted port range and IP CIDR:  
```  
aws ec2 replace-network-acl-entry --network-acl-id   --protocol tcp --rule-action allow --rule-number <ruleNumber> --ingress --cidr-block <ipCidr> --port-range From=<port>,To=<port>  
```   
**3.** To delete an unrestricted rule (allowed ingress connection of SSH\ RDP with 0.0.0.0/0) use the rule number from the previous output in the following command:  
  
```  
aws ec2 delete-network-acl-entry --network-acl-id {{naclId}} --ingress --rule-number <ruleNumber>  
```

Perform the following commands to delete or modify an inbound NACL rule to restrict remote administration ports access to specific entities via AWS CLI:   
**1.** To view the current NACL configuration:   
```  
aws ec2 describe-network-acls --network-acl-ids {{naclId}}  
```  
**2.** To modify an inbound rule, use the rule number from the previous output in the following command, and insert the wanted port range and IP CIDR:  
```  
aws ec2 replace-network-acl-entry --network-acl-id   --protocol tcp --rule-action allow --rule-number <ruleNumber> --ingress --cidr-block <ipCidr> --port-range From=<port>,To=<port>  
```   
**3.** To delete an unrestricted rule (allowed ingress connection of SSH\ RDP with 0.0.0.0/0) use the rule number from the previous output in the following command:  
  
```  
aws ec2 delete-network-acl-entry --network-acl-id {{naclId}} --ingress --rule-number <ruleNumber>  
```
